Comparison of landscape: The expert noted that the barren landscape in the picture resembled the rocky surface of Mars, suggesting that it was not taken on Earth.
Reverse image search: The expert conducted a reverse image search on Google and found a tweet with the same image, which identified it as a shot of Phobos over the northern limb of Mount Sharp on Mars. This provided evidence that the picture was not of Earth.
Verification of the source: The expert investigated the Twitter handle @MarsCuriosity and confirmed that it belonged to NASA, the US space agency. They also mentioned that the Curiosity rover, which captured the image, was launched by NASA to explore Mars. This verified the credibility of the source and the authenticity of the image.
Confirmation from NASA: The expert searched NASA's website and found actual images of Earth taken by Curiosity in 2014 and 2020. This confirmed that the specific image in question was not of Earth, as claimed in the Facebook post.
